recommendations.title: London council worker's bus odyssey sparks Twitter storm
recommendations.excerpt: When Jo Kibble, a 39-year-old council employee from Greenwich, set out to travel as far as he could from London in one day only using public bus routes it was supposed to be a personal project.

recommendations.title: The 12 Deadliest Insects in the World
recommendations.excerpt: A dozen biting, stinging, venom-injecting, shock-inducing, and disease-carrying insects and arachnids. These are some bad bugs.

recommendations.title: What Does It Mean That Greenland Sharks Could Live for 500 Years or More?
recommendations.excerpt: About 15 years ago, during a fishing expedition off the west coast of Greenland, Danish marine biologist John Steffensen spotted a local hunter in a small boat. A large, voluminous dull-gray shark hung from the boat’s edge.

recommendations.title: The New Chief Chaplain at Harvard? An Atheist.
recommendations.excerpt: The elevation of Greg Epstein, author of “Good Without God,” reflects a broader trend of young people who increasingly identify as spiritual but religiously nonaffiliated.

recommendations.title: How the US created a world of endless war
recommendations.excerpt: On 23 May 2013, the peace activist Medea Benjamin attended a speech by President Barack Obama at Fort McNair in Washington DC, where he defended his administration’s use of armed drones in counter-terrorism.

recommendations.title: How to Identify Your 'Dominant Emotional Style' (and Why It's so Important)
recommendations.excerpt: During difficult times, we often find ourselves defaulting to a single, dominant emotion, even when another might be more “logical.”

recommendations.title: Femme Fatale
recommendations.excerpt: When Zoe Whittall discovered the word femme as a teenager in the 1990s, it felt like a homecoming and transgression all at once. But what meaning does the word hold now that you can buy t-shirts emblazoned with it with a click of a button?

recommendations.title: Inside The Beautiful World Of Sally Rooney
recommendations.excerpt: In just four short years, Sally Rooney has gone from debut author to a novelist of global renown. As excitement builds for her third book, she tells Olivia Marks how she is reckoning with her reality. Photographs by Perry Ogden

recommendations.title: What will it be like when COVID-19 becomes endemic?
recommendations.excerpt: Difficult to predict timeline as duration of vaccine protection, social contact, and transmissibility play key roles, says expert

recommendations.title: Why the health risks of overheating go unnoticed
recommendations.excerpt: By the end of the century, three-quarters of the world could be at risk of deadly heat. And yet, we still struggle to design cities to be heatwave ready.

recommendations.title: What I Learned While Eavesdropping on the Taliban
recommendations.excerpt: I spent 600 hours listening in on the people who now run Afghanistan. It wasn’t until the end of my tour that I understood what they were telling me. About the author: Ian Fritz served in the U.S. Air Force from 2008 to 2013.

recommendations.title: Tortilla Española Recipe
recommendations.excerpt: This classic Spanish dish can be sliced into wedges for breakfast or lunch, or cut into cubes for tapas.

recommendations.title: The Great Millennial Blood Pressure Problem
recommendations.excerpt: Why it’s climbing faster in young people.

recommendations.title: Jonah Hill Is SuperGood
recommendations.excerpt: His 20s were wild: a parade of raunchy, era-defining comedies. Then Jonah Hill shifted gears, directing a deeply personal film and taking on the kinds of rich, complex roles he’s always wanted.

recommendations.title: Unhappy Little Trees: The Dark Legacy of Bob Ross
recommendations.excerpt: A new Netflix documentary explores a battle over the late TV painter—and the endless anger that continues today.

recommendations.title: Stop Giving Companies Your Phone Number. Do This Instead.
recommendations.excerpt: Facebook and Twitter admit that marketers accessed the phone numbers people gave them for security verification. Here’s how to protect yourself without handing over your digits.

recommendations.title: She flew to Tonga for a weekend. 18 months later she's still stuck there
recommendations.excerpt: Nearly 18 months after she flew in for the weekend, Zoe Stephens is still stuck on the tiny archipelago, which happens to be one of the few places in the world that has remained entirely Covid-free.

recommendations.title: Inside the world’s most booked Airbnb
recommendations.excerpt: The world’s most popular Airbnb listing isn’t easy to find. From San Francisco, the journey begins with an hourlong drive down Interstate 280 and a windy traverse of “Killer 17” — one of the most accident-prone highways in California.

recommendations.title: Mexican Street Corn Soup Recipe
recommendations.excerpt: Sweet and spicy soup, inspired by the beloved Mexican street food.

recommendations.title: Why does quitting your job still feel so hard?
recommendations.excerpt: Quitting – particularly without a job to go to – can be emotionally challenging and carry stigma. Can the Great Resignation change that?

recommendations.title: 35 Brilliant Albert Einstein Quotes to Inspire You to Greatness
recommendations.excerpt: You may know Albert Einstein as the physicist who taught us the theory of relativity. Or maybe you know him as that guy who created that formula E= mc² (and maybe despised in middle school science class) that proved matter can be turned into energy. Einstein wasn’t always considered a genius.

recommendations.title: The Cotton Tote Crisis
recommendations.excerpt: Recently, Venetia Berry, an artist in London, counted up the free cotton tote bags that she had accumulated in her closet. There were at least 25.

recommendations.title: How Brett Goldstein Became the Breakout Star of 'Ted Lasso'
recommendations.excerpt: The man behind Roy Kent explains how he went from the writing room to playing the hit show’s fan-favorite character — and why he identifies so much with him.

recommendations.title: ‘I can’t risk my children’s lives’: the families left behind at mercy of Taliban
recommendations.excerpt: When the email arrived last Tuesday, Faaiz Ghulam and his young family were euphoric. Approved for evacuation, they were instructed to head straight to the west gate of Kabul’s Baron Hotel. There, British officials would process their case. Next step, the UK.

recommendations.title: The Pain and Pride of Britain’s Wildest Ballgame
recommendations.excerpt: Every Shrove Tuesday, the entire town of Ashbourne erupts in a brutal football match where almost anything goes and the rare glory of scoring a goal is savored for generations.

recommendations.title: How ordinary people are convinced to become spies
recommendations.excerpt: A new film starring Benedict Cumberbatch, The Courier, tells the story of the salesman, Grenville Wynne, caught up in the murky world of espionage during the Cuban Missile Crisis.

recommendations.title: 3 Ingredient Yogurt Cake (No Flour, Butter, or Oil)
recommendations.excerpt: This creamy yogurt cake is just 3 ingredients and takes only a few minutes to prepare. You don’t even need a mixer to make the batter. You also don’t need flour, butter or oil to make the cake.  The cake is low in sugar and calories.

recommendations.title: I’ll Tell You the Secret of Cancer
recommendations.excerpt: It’s been almost 20 years since my diagnosis, and I’ve learned quite a bit. Are you someone who enjoys the unsolicited opinions of strangers and acquaintances? If so, I can’t recommend cancer highly enough.

recommendations.title: Are you ready for the return of prep?
recommendations.excerpt: TikTok is rediscovering preppy fashion, except this time it’s called the “old money aesthetic.”

recommendations.title: The Uniform Cool of Charlie Watts
recommendations.excerpt: “Style is the answer to everything,” Charles Bukowski, of all people, once said in a lecture that’s still afloat in the ether of YouTube.

items.title: Play Forge of Empires Now for Free
items.excerpt: If you like to play, this strategy game is a must-have.

items.title: Get £230,000 Life Insurance From £10 per Month
items.excerpt: If you were born between 1961 and 1995, find out how you can get affordable life insurance.
